resources.string: Seek medical attention if symptoms worsen or do not fade within 24 hours:
Phone NHS 24 on 111 for medical advice
Due to the risk of delayed onset of symptoms do not play sports, drive or drink alcohol or leave him/her alone for the next 24 hours.
Seek medical advice or reassess if new symptoms appear.
• Scottish Intercollegiate Guidelines Network, 110 Early Management of Patients with a Head Injury, http://www.sign.ac.uk/pdf/sign110.pdf

• Harmon KG, Drezner JA, Gammons M, et al. American Medical Society for Sports Medicine position statement: concussion in sport, Br J Sports Med 2013,47, 15–26 http://bjsm.bmj.com/content/47/1/15.full

• McCrory P, Meeuwisse WH, Aubry M,et al. Consensus statement on concussion in sport: the 4th International Conference on Concussion in Sport held in Zurich, November 2012, Br J Sports Med 2013;47:250–258. http://bjsm.bmj.com/content/47/5/250.full
